lines.text: the more you get the more you want.
Cody College... 8 miles
Well, after approaching the subject from every standpoint very objectively, I think it would be to our mutual advantage if we became engaged.
You know I like to put my cards on the table.
Well I think you could have taken out the joker.

You just don't ask a girl to marry you like you're going to the hardware store to buy a coffeegrinder. I mean you just don't come up to a girl and say 'The humidity is very high for this time of year will you marry me?'
I just didn't want to get... uh romantic.
Oh you just didn't want to get "UH" romantic. What are you saving it for?
Were you always out of your mind?
No, no just lately.
Looks a little nervous, doesn't he?
He's a study...
Yea...
...in suicide.
Hi ya Church, hows your steeple?
So long Polly, watch your crackers!
He certainly does pack a terrific wallop.
Who?
Mr. Put-Your-Cards-On-The-Table.
[scoffs]
He's a very nice fella.
Yes. He's a very nice fella, just the guy to get Juliet off the balcony...
Supposing we just forget all about it.
Yes, sir, but the student council.
Hoot on the student council. There's my glass.
[Pulls out a pair of glasses]
If this young man thinks we're a...
A diljo?
A diljo, that's his privilege. We're still in America, aren't we?
Yes, sir.
Well that gives him a right to cal us a diljo.
[to Danny]
As for you, young man, supposing you stop unpacking, packing and resigning... and start learning something around here? Huh?
Yes, sir,
Well, get going, both of you.
[They start to leave]
Oh, just a minute. There's another American custom.
[Walks over and puts their hands together for a handshake; they smile and shake]
Well, don't stand there like Ike and Mike, scoot.

[Danny is about to crown the Queen of the Rodeo]
You're about to see a man buried alive!
